message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.SI, cs.CE

The paper presents an application of neural networks (NN) in the renewable energy domain, specifically for the prediction of solar radiation. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) or Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The use of Multi-Layer Perceptron (MLP) also supports this assumption, as MLP is a type of NN commonly used in machine learning. Additionally, the paper involves optimization of the MLP, which could fall under the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category. The paper also mentions conventional methods such as ARIMA techniques, Bayesian inference, Markov chains, and k-Nearest-Neighbors approximators, which suggests that the paper could belong to the Statistical Learning (cs.SI) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with renewable energy, which could place it under the Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science (cs.CE) sub-category.
